page.title: 05Farms around Haywood
page.content: There are 17 working farms in the area. My class visited all of them.Most people owned their farms very few rented. A number of the old farm houses had been replaced by new ones; many of the old farmhouses were over a hundred years old and had been built over older buildings. Most farms had cows, some had sheep and a few had horses. The horses were not working horses. Cows were used for milk and beef. Freisian, Freisian/Hereford and Freisain/Charolais crosses were the most common types of cows. The farmers milked in morning and evening. The crops were mostly grass for silage and hay, winter barley, spring barley and wheat.Most farms had tractors, trailers, silerators, ploughs, harrows and drills. Only one farm had its own Combine Harvester.
